newsitem.title: CHINA: China foreign debt $109.57 bln at end-June.
newsitem.headline: China foreign debt $109.57 bln at end-June.

text.p: China's total foreign debt stood at $109.57 billion at the end of June, up 6.3 percent compared with the same period last year, the State Administration of Exchange Control said on Tuesday.
It was up by $6.53 billion compared with end-June 1995, the administration said in a report issued by the Xinhua news agency.
It was up by 2.8 percent, or $2.98 billion, compared with the end of 1995, the administration said.
Short-term debt fell by 2.7 percent to $11.6 billion while medium-term debt was up by 3.5 percent to $97.97 billion compared with year-ago period, it said.

Government debt accounted for 30.2 percent of the total, while debt of financial institutions accounted for 39.1 percent and state enterprises 10.6 percent. Debts of foreign-funded enterprises accounted for 18.6 percent and leasing companies held 1.5 percent, it said.
The figures showed that the proportion of debt held by foreign enterprises had increased gradually in recent years, it said but gave no other details.
